ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] I'm Baaaaaaaack
ygData.msgSnippet: What??!! I have surround speakers but they only work on a few games or when I play a DVD. Definitely not in EQ. Are there settings somewhere in EQ to activate
ygData.messageBody:
What??!!
 
I have surround speakers but they only work on a few games or when I play a DVD. Definitely not in EQ.
Are there settings somewhere in EQ to activate this?  I tell you what though. The thunder with my new subwoofer is nutso.
 
T.
----- Original Message -----
From: Wulfric Rennison
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, November 14, 2003 10:03 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] I'm Baaaaaaaack

Well a monitor helps too.  Good to be able to see things ya know.  And although it's probably not mandatory, I find a sound card really works wonders.  In fact, I'd suggest spending a little more money for a really nice sound card that supports suround sound and digital audio, then get yourself a set of surround sound speakers cause EQ does support it.  The benefit of this is that you can tell if something is behind you, in front of you, or off to the side.  And depending on the quality you may hear it approaching.  That gives you a chance to meet the attacker head on rather than being surprised from behind.  It's a very cool effect that I think really enhances the game.  I was quite surprised and impressed when I discovered this.
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Colleen and Theresa
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, November 13, 2003 2:14 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] I'm Baaaaaaaack


are there any extras you need on your computer or do most of you use just a keyboard and mouse?

 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Melanie Johnson
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, November 13, 2003 5:20 AM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] I'm Baaaaaaaack


--- "Steven R. Hulse" <steveh@...> wrote:
> Not sure yet. I'm still re-familiarizing myself with
> all the commands again!
> LOL So far it seems ok. I've had to redo a few of my
> keys but other than
> that everything else is cool, I do like the map
> feature though! That is
> really going to be helpful, though do I have all the
> maps or do I need to
> explore an area to gain them?
>
> Steve
>

I haven't checked it in a while, but eqtoolbox.com use
to have maps to most, if not all, the zones out there
for download. Might want to check it out. ;)
